Posted By: Mike-C (5/25/2012 10:24:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: True to its name, the Might is quite good with some of the Nephilims. What's not to like about instant-speed +8/+8 for two mana? [Glint-Eye Nephilim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glint-Eye Nephilim) can draw you 10 nice cards, and the [Witch-Maw](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=107090) scores trample even if he had no counters on him... you'd have to play the Might on him *before* you attack, though. It can also make sure the [Yore-tiller Nephilim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yore-tiller Nephilim) makes it through an attack, and on [Ink-Treader Nephilim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ink-Treader Nephilim)... it can make one heck of a finisher if you have a deck based around multi-coloured creatures. ([Knight of New Alara](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight of New Alara)? [Defiler of Souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Defiler of Souls)? [Pillar of the Paruns](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pillar of the Paruns)? It's possible.)
posts.html:
True to its name, the Might is quite good with some of the Nephilims. What's not to like about instant-speed +8/+8 for two mana? Glint-Eye Nephilim can draw you 10 nice cards, and the Witch-Maw scores trample even if he had no counters on him... you'd have to play the Might on him before you attack, though. It can also make sure the Yore-tiller Nephilim makes it through an attack, and on Ink-Treader Nephilim... it can make one heck of a finisher if you have a deck based around multi-coloured creatures. (Knight of New Alara? Defiler of Souls? Pillar of the Paruns? It's possible.)
